<li id="cite_note-NAT-20190910-26"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-NAT-20190910_26-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-NAT-20190910_26-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFMounierLahr2019">Mounier, Aurélien; Lahr, Marta (2019). <a class="external text" href="//www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6736881" rel="nofollow">"Deciphering African late middle Pleistocene hominin diversity and the origin of our species"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Nature_Communications" title="Nature Communications">Nature Communications</a></i>. <b>10</b> (1): 3406. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Bibcode_(identifier)" title="Bibcode (identifier)">Bibcode</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://ui.adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/2019NatCo..10.3406M" rel="nofollow">2019NatCo..10.3406M</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1038%2Fs41467-019-11213-w" rel="nofollow">10.1038/s41467-019-11213-w</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/PMC_(identifier)" title="PMC (identifier)">PMC</a> <span class="cs1-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a class="external text" href="//www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6736881" rel="nofollow">6736881</a></span>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/PMID_(identifier)" title="PMID (identifier)">PMID</a> <a class="external text" href="//pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/31506422" rel="nofollow">31506422</a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Nature+Communications&amp;rft.atitle=Deciphering+African+late+middle+Pleistocene+hominin+diversity+and+the+origin+of+our+species&amp;rft.volume=10&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.pages=3406&amp;rft.date=2019&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fwww.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov%2Fpmc%2Farticles%2FPMC6736881%23id-name%3DPMC&amp;rft_id=info%3Apmid%2F31506422&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1038%2Fs41467-019-11213-w&amp;rft_id=info%3Abibcode%2F2019NatCo..10.3406M&amp;rft.aulast=Mounier&amp;rft.aufirst=Aur%C3%A9lien&amp;rft.au=Lahr%2C+Marta&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fwww.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov%2Fpmc%2Farticles%2FPMC6736881&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAfrica"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Vidal22-27"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Vidal22_27-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFVidalLaneAsfawrossen2022">Vidal, Celine M.; Lane, Christine S.; Asfawrossen, Asrat;  et al. (January 2022). <a class="external text" href="//www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC8791829" rel="nofollow">"Age of the oldest known Homo sapiens from eastern Africa"</a>. <i>Nature</i>. <b>601</b> (7894): 579–583. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Bibcode_(identifier)" title="Bibcode (identifier)">Bibcode</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://ui.adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/2022Natur.601..579V" rel="nofollow">2022Natur.601..579V</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1038%2Fs41586-021-04275-8" rel="nofollow">10.1038/s41586-021-04275-8</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/PMC_(identifier)" title="PMC (identifier)">PMC</a> <span class="cs1-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a class="external text" href="//www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC8791829" rel="nofollow">8791829</a></span>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/PMID_(identifier)" title="PMID (identifier)">PMID</a> <a class="external text" href="//pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/35022610" rel="nofollow">35022610</a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Nature&amp;rft.atitle=Age+of+the+oldest+known+Homo+sapiens+from+eastern+Africa&amp;rft.volume=601&amp;rft.issue=7894&amp;rft.pages=579-583&amp;rft.date=2022-01&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fwww.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov%2Fpmc%2Farticles%2FPMC8791829%23id-name%3DPMC&amp;rft_id=info%3Apmid%2F35022610&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1038%2Fs41586-021-04275-8&amp;rft_id=info%3Abibcode%2F2022Natur.601..579V&amp;rft.aulast=Vidal&amp;rft.aufirst=Celine+M.&amp;rft.au=Lane%2C+Christine+S.&amp;rft.au=Asfawrossen%2C+Asrat&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fwww.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov%2Fpmc%2Farticles%2FPMC8791829&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAfrica"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-28"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-28">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-22"><a href="#cite_note-22">[22]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Schlebusch2017_23-0"><a href="#cite_note-Schlebusch2017-23">[23]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Guardian_24-0"><a href="#cite_note-Guardian-24">[24]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NYT-20190910_25-0"><a href="#cite_note-NYT-20190910-25">[25]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NAT-20190910_26-0"><a href="#cite_note-NAT-20190910-26">[26]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Vidal22_27-0"><a href="#cite_note-Vidal22-27">[27]</a></sup></span>

<li id="cite_note-32"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-32">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The <a href="/wiki/Egba_United_Government" title="Egba United Government">Egba United Government</a>, a government of the <a href="/wiki/Egba_people" title="Egba people">Egba people</a>, was legally recognized by the British as independent until being annexed into the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Colony_and_Protectorate_of_Nigeria" title="Colony and Protectorate of Nigeria">Colony and Protectorate of Nigeria</a> in 1914: <link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFDaly2019">Daly, Samuel Fury Childs (4 May 2019). <a class="external text" href="https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/abs/10.1080/03086534.2019.1576833" rel="nofollow">"From Crime to Coercion: Policing Dissent in Abeokuta, Nigeria, 1900–1940"</a>. <i>The Journal of Imperial and Commonwealth History</i>. <b>47</b> (3): 474–489. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1080%2F03086534.2019.1576833" rel="nofollow">10.1080/03086534.2019.1576833</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISSN_(identifier)" title="ISSN (identifier)">ISSN</a> <a class="external text" href="//www.worldcat.org/issn/0308-6534" rel="nofollow">0308-6534</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/S2CID_(identifier)" title="S2CID (identifier)">S2CID</a> <a class="external text" href="https://api.semanticscholar.org/CorpusID:159124664" rel="nofollow">159124664</a>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220407145030/https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/abs/10.1080/03086534.2019.1576833" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 7 April 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">5 July</span> 2022</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+Journal+of+Imperial+and+Commonwealth+History&amp;rft.atitle=From+Crime+to+Coercion%3A+Policing+Dissent+in+Abeokuta%2C+Nigeria%2C+1900%E2%80%931940&amp;rft.volume=47&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.pages=474-489&amp;rft.date=2019-05-04&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fapi.semanticscholar.org%2FCorpusID%3A159124664%23id-name%3DS2CID&amp;rft.issn=0308-6534&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1080%2F03086534.2019.1576833&amp;rft.aulast=Daly&amp;rft.aufirst=Samuel+Fury+Childs&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.tandfonline.com%2Fdoi%2Fabs%2F10.1080%2F03086534.2019.1576833&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAfrica"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-33"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-33">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation encyclopaedia cs1 cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source" id="CITEREFGeorges1913–1918">Georges, Karl Ernst (1913–1918). <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20160116044500/http://latin_german.deacademic.com/1644" rel="nofollow">"Afri"</a>. <li id="cite_note-34"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-34">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation encyclopaedia cs1" id="CITEREFLewisShort1879">Lewis, Charlton T.; Short, Charles (1879). <a class="external text" href="https://www.perseus.tufts.edu/hopper/text?doc=Perseus%3Atext%3A1999.04.0059%3Aentry%3DAfer" rel="nofollow">"Afer"</a>. <i>A Latin Dictionary</i>. Oxford: Clarendon Press. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20160116044500/http://www.perseus.tufts.edu/hopper/text?doc=Perseus%3Atext%3A1999.04.0059%3Aentry%3DAfer" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 16 January 2016<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">20 September</span> 2015</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=Afer&amp;rft.btitle=A+Latin+Dictionary&amp;rft.place=Oxford&amp;rft.pub=Clarendon+Press&amp;rft.date=1879&amp;rft.aulast=Lewis&amp;rft.aufirst=Charlton+T.&amp;rft.au=Short%2C+Charles&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.perseus.tufts.edu%2Fhopper%2Ftext%3Fdoc%3DPerseus%253Atext%253A1999.04.0059%253Aentry%253DAfer&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAfrica"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-35"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-35">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Venter &amp; Neuland, <i>NEPAD and the African Renaissance</i> (2005), p. 16</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-36"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-36">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFDesfayes2011">Desfayes, Michel (25 January 2011). <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20190627022921/http://michel-desfayes.org/namesofcountries.html" rel="nofollow">"The Names of Countries"</a>. <i>michel-desfayes.org</i>. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://michel-desfayes.org/namesofcountries.html" rel="nofollow">the original</a> on 27 June 2019<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">9 April</span> 2019</span>. <q>Africa. From the name of an ancient tribe in Tunisia, the <i>Afri</i> (adjective: <i>Afer</i>). The name is still extant today as <i>Ifira</i> and <i>Ifri-n-Dellal</i> in Greater Kabylia (Algeria). A Berber tribe was called <i>Beni-Ifren</i> in the Middle Ages and <i>Ifurace</i> was the name of a Tripolitan people in the 6th century. The name is from the Berber language <i>ifri</i> 'cave'. Troglodytism was frequent in northern Africa and still occurs today in southern Tunisia. Herodote wrote that the Garamantes, a North African people, used to live in caves. The Ancient Greek called <i>troglodytēs</i> an African people who lived in caves. <i>Africa</i> was coined by the Romans and <span class="nowrap" style="padding-left:0.1em;">'</span><i>Ifriqiyeh</i><span class="nowrap" style="padding-left:0.1em;">'</span> is the arabized Latin name. (Most details from Decret &amp; Fantar, 1981).</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=michel-desfayes.org&amp;rft.atitle=The+Names+of+Countries&amp;rft.date=2011-01-25&amp;rft.aulast=Desfayes&amp;rft.aufirst=Michel&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fmichel-desfayes.org%2Fnamesofcountries.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAfrica"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Michell-37"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Michell_37-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Michell_37-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFBabington_Michell1903">Babington Michell, Geo (1903). <a class="external text" href="https://zenodo.org/record/1782363" rel="nofollow">"The Berbers"</a>. <i>Journal of the Royal African Society</i>. <b>2</b> (6): 161–194. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1093%2Foxfordjournals.afraf.a093193" rel="nofollow">10.1093/oxfordjournals.afraf.a093193</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/JSTOR_(identifier)" title="JSTOR (identifier)">JSTOR</a> <a class="external text" href="//www.jstor.org/stable/714549" rel="nofollow">714549</a>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20201230012624/https://zenodo.org/record/1782363" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 30 December 2020<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">30 August</span> 2020</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+the+Royal+African+Society&amp;rft.atitle=The+Berbers&amp;rft.volume=2&amp;rft.issue=6&amp;rft.pages=161-194&amp;rft.date=1903&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1093%2Foxfordjournals.afraf.a093193&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fwww.jstor.org%2Fstable%2F714549%23id-name%3DJSTOR&amp;rft.aulast=Babington+Michell&amp;rft.aufirst=Geo&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fzenodo.org%2Frecord%2F1782363&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAfrica"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-38"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-38">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=SLSzNfdcqfoC&amp;pg=PA200" rel="nofollow">Edward Lipinski, <i>Itineraria Phoenicia</i></a> <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20160116044459/https://books.google.com/books?id=SLSzNfdcqfoC&amp;pg=PA200" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> 16 January 2016 at the <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a>, Peeters Publishers, 2004, p. 200. <link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/90-429-1344-4" title="Special:BookSources/90-429-1344-4">90-429-1344-4</a></span>

<li id="cite_note-41"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-41">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFFruyt,_M.1976">Fruyt, M. (1976). <li id="cite_note-42"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-42">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFStieglitz1984">Stieglitz, Robert R. (1984). <li id="cite_note-59"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-59">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFKeenan,_Jeremy2013">Keenan, Jeremy (2013). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=KUKPAQAAQBAJ" rel="nofollow"><i>The Sahara: Past, Present and Future</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-72"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-72">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFCubryTranchant-DubreuilThuilletMonat2018">Cubry, Philippe; Tranchant-Dubreuil, Christine; Thuillet, Anne-Céline; Monat, Cécile; Ndjiondjop, Marie-Noelle; Labadie, Karine; Cruaud, Corinne; Engelen, Stefan; Scarcelli, Nora; Rhoné, Bénédicte; Burgarella, Concetta; Dupuy, Christian; Larmande, Pierre; Wincker, Patrick; François, Olivier; Sabot, François; Vigouroux, Yves (2018). <a class="external text" href="https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0960982218307024" rel="nofollow">"The Rise and Fall of African Rice Cultivation Revealed by Analysis of 246 New Genomes"</a>. <i>Current Biology</i>. <b>28</b> (14): 2274–2282.e6. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1016%2Fj.cub.2018.05.066" rel="nofollow">10.1016/j.cub.2018.05.066</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/PMID_(identifier)" title="PMID (identifier)">PMID</a> <a class="external text" href="//pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/29983312" rel="nofollow">29983312</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/S2CID_(identifier)" title="S2CID (identifier)">S2CID</a> <a class="external text" href="https://api.semanticscholar.org/CorpusID:51600014" rel="nofollow">51600014</a>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220520170745/https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0960982218307024" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 20 May 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-73"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-73">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFShawn_Sabrina_Murray2004">Shawn Sabrina Murray (January 2004). <a class="external text" href="https://www.researchgate.net/publication/265663363" rel="nofollow">"Searching for the Origins of African Rice Domestication"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Antiquity_(journal)" title="Antiquity (journal)">Antiquity</a></i> (78) – via researchgate.net.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Antiquity&amp;rft.atitle=Searching+for+the+Origins+of+African+Rice+Domestication&amp;rft.issue=78&amp;rft.date=2004-01&amp;rft.au=Shawn+Sabrina+Murray&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.researchgate.net%2Fpublication%2F265663363&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAfrica"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-111"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-111">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"> The <a href="/wiki/Egba_United_Government" title="Egba United Government">Egba United Government</a>, a government of the <a href="/wiki/Egba_people" title="Egba people">Egba people</a>, was legally recognized by the British as independent until being annexed into the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Colony_and_Protectorate_of_Nigeria" title="Colony and Protectorate of Nigeria">Colony and Protectorate of Nigeria</a> in 1914: <link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFDaly2019">Daly, Samuel Fury Childs (4 May 2019). <a class="external text" Commonwealth History</i>. <b>47</b> (3): 474–489. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1080%2F03086534.2019.1576833" rel="nofollow">10.1080/03086534.2019.1576833</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISSN_(identifier)" title="ISSN (identifier)">ISSN</a> <a "Evidence for motion between Nubia and Somalia along the Southwest Indian ridge". <i>Nature</i>. <b>398</b> (6722): 64–67. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Bibcode_(identifier)" title="Bibcode (identifier)">Bibcode</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://ui.adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/1999Natur.398...64C" rel="nofollow">1999Natur.398...64C</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1038%2F18014" rel="nofollow">10.1038/18014</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/S2CID_(identifier)" title="S2CID (identifier)">S2CID</a> <a class="external text" href="https://api.semanticscholar.org/CorpusID:4403043" rel="nofollow">4403043</a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Nature&amp;rft.atitle=Evidence+for+motion+between+Nubia+and+Somalia+along+the+Southwest+Indian+ridge&amp;rft.volume=398&amp;rft.issue=6722&amp;rft.pages=64-67&amp;rft.date=1999&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fapi.semanticscholar.org%2FCorpusID%3A4403043%23id-name%3DS2CID&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1038%2F18014&amp;rft_id=info%3Abibcode%2F1999Natur.398...64C&amp;rft.aulast=Chu&amp;rft.aufirst=D.&amp;rft.au=Gordon%2C+R.G.&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAfrica"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-environmentalatlas-137"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-environmentalatlas_137-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-environmentalatlas_137-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-environmentalatlas_137-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a class="external text" href="http://www.africa.upenn.edu/afrfocus/afrfocus061708.html" rel="nofollow">"Africa: Environmental Atlas, 06/17/08."</a> <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20120105193432/http://www.africa.upenn.edu/afrfocus/afrfocus061708.html" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> 5 January 2012 at the <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a> <a class="external text" href="http://www.africa.upenn.edu" rel="nofollow">African Studies Center</a> <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20110731143110/http://www.africa.upenn.edu/" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> 31 July 2011 at the <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a>, University of Pennsylvania. Accessed June 2011.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-newRecord-138"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-newRecord_138-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFEl_Fadli2012">El Fadli, KI;  et al. (September 2012). <a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1175%2FBAMS-D-12-00093.1" rel="nofollow">"World Meteorological Organization Assessment of the Purported World Record 58°C Temperature Extreme at El Azizia, Libya (13 September 1922)"</a>. <i>Bulletin of the American Meteorological Society</i>. <b>94</b> (2): 199. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Bibcode_(identifier)" title="Bibcode (identifier)">Bibcode</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://ui.adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/2013BAMS...94..199E" rel="nofollow">2013BAMS...94..199E</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<span class="cs1-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1175%2FBAMS-D-12-00093.1" rel="nofollow">10.1175/BAMS-D-12-00093.1</a></span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Bulletin+of+the+American+Meteorological+Society&amp;rft.atitle=World+Meteorological+Organization+Assessment+of+the+Purported+World+Record+58%C2%B0C+Temperature+Extreme+at+El+Azizia%2C+Libya+%2813+September+1922%29&amp;rft.volume=94&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.pages=199&amp;rft.date=2012-09&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1175%2FBAMS-D-12-00093.1&amp;rft_id=info%3Abibcode%2F2013BAMS...94..199E&amp;rft.aulast=El+Fadli&amp;rft.aufirst=KI&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fdoi.org%2F10.1175%252FBAMS-D-12-00093.1&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAfrica"></span> (The 136 °F (57.8 °C), claimed by <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/%27Aziziya" title="'Aziziya">'Aziziya</a>, <a href="/wiki/Libya" title="Libya">Libya</a>, on 13 September 1922, has been officially deemed invalid by the <a href="/wiki/World_Meteorological_Organization" title="World Meteorological Organization">World Meteorological Organization</a>.)</span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-Water_in_Africa_:8-149"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Water_in_Africa_:8_149-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Water_in_Africa_:8_149-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFAnthony_Gachanja,_Pedro_Mastrangelo,_Kevin_Mcguigan,_Presthantie_Naicker_and_Feleke_Zewge2010">Anthony Gachanja, Pedro Mastrangelo, Kevin Mcguigan, Presthantie Naicker and Feleke Zewge (2010). <a class="external text" href="https://www.rsc.org/search-results/?q=Africa%27s%20Water%20Quality%3A%20A%20chemical%20Science%20Perspective" rel="nofollow"><i>Africa's Water Quality: A Chemical Science Perspective</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-152"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-152">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFSchneider,_S.H.2007">Schneider, S.H.;  et al. (2007). "19.3.3 Regional vulnerabilities".  In Parry, M.L.;  et al. (eds.). <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20130312104158/http://www.ipcc.ch/publications_and_data/ar4/wg2/en/ch19s19-3-3.html" rel="nofollow"><i>Chapter 19: Assessing Key Vulnerabilities and the Risk from Climate Change</i></a>. Climate change 2007: impacts, adaptation, and vulnerability: contribution of Working Group II to the fourth assessment report of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC). Cambridge University Press (CUP): Cambridge, UK: Print version: CUP. Marseille: IRD éditions. 2017. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-2-7099-2424-5" title="Special:BookSources/978-2-7099-2424-5"><bdi>978-2-7099-2424-5</bdi></a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/OCLC_(identifier)" title="OCLC (identifier)">OCLC</a> <a class="external text" href="//www.worldcat.org/oclc/1034784045" rel="nofollow">1034784045</a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Rural+societies+in+the+face+of+climatic+and+environmental+changes+in+West+Africa&amp;rft.place=Marseille&amp;rft.pub=IRD+%C3%A9ditions&amp;rft.date=2017&amp;rft_id=info%3Aoclcnum%2F1034784045&amp;rft.isbn=978-2-7099-2424-5&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAfrica"></span><span class="cs1-maint citation-comment"><code class="cs1-code">{{<a href="/wiki/Template:Cite_book" title="Template:Cite book">cite book</a>}}</code>:  CS1 maint: others (<a href="/wiki/Category:CS1_maint:_others" title="Category:CS1 maint: others">link</a>)</span></span>

<li id="cite_note-Climate_change_in_Africa_:11-166"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Climate_change_in_Africa_:11_166-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Climate_change_in_Africa_:11_166-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFCollins2011">Collins, Jennifer M. (18 March 2011). "Temperature Variability over Africa". <i>Journal of Climate</i>. <b>24</b> (14): 3649–3666. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Bibcode_(identifier)" title="Bibcode (identifier)">Bibcode</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://ui.adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/2011JCli...24.3649C" rel="nofollow">2011JCli...24.3649C</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1175%2F2011JCLI3753.1" rel="nofollow">10.1175/2011JCLI3753.1</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISSN_(identifier)" title="ISSN (identifier)">ISSN</a> <a class="external text" href="//www.worldcat.org/issn/0894-8755" rel="nofollow">0894-8755</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/S2CID_(identifier)" title="S2CID (identifier)">S2CID</a> <a class="external text" href="https://api.semanticscholar.org/CorpusID:129446962" rel="nofollow">129446962</a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Climate&amp;rft.atitle=Temperature+Variability+over+Africa&amp;rft.volume=24&amp;rft.issue=14&amp;rft.pages=3649-3666&amp;rft.date=2011-03-18&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1175%2F2011JCLI3753.1&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fapi.semanticscholar.org%2FCorpusID%3A129446962%23id-name%3DS2CID&amp;rft.issn=0894-8755&amp;rft_id=info%3Abibcode%2F2011JCli...24.3649C&amp;rft.aulast=Collins&amp;rft.aufirst=Jennifer+M.&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAfrica"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-Climate_change_in_Africa_:15-167"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Climate_change_in_Africa_:15_167-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFConwayPersechinoArdoin-BardinHamandawana2009">Conway, Declan; <li id="cite_note-180"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-180">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFTausch2018">Tausch, Arno (2018). <a class="external text" href="https://mpra.ub.uni-muenchen.de/87966/1/MPRA_paper_87966.pdf" rel="nofollow">"Africa on the Maps of Global Values: Comparative Analyses, Based on Recent World Values Survey Data"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.2139%2Fssrn.3214715" rel="nofollow">10.2139/ssrn.3214715</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/S2CID_(identifier)" title="S2CID (identifier)">S2CID</a> <a class="external text" href="https://api.semanticscholar.org/CorpusID:158596579" rel="nofollow">158596579</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/SSRN_(identifier)" title="SSRN (identifier)">SSRN</a> <a class="external text" href="//papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=3214715" rel="nofollow">3214715</a>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20200211141227/https://mpra.ub.uni-muenchen.de/87966/1/MPRA_paper_87966.pdf" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> from the original on 11 February 2020<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-World-202"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-World_202-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation encyclopaedia cs1"><span class="cs1-lock-registration" title="Free registration required"><a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/1989worldbookencyclo22worl" rel="nofollow">"Africa"</a></span>. <i><a href="/wiki/World_Book_Encyclopedia" title="World Book Encyclopedia">World Book Encyclopedia</a></i>. </li>
<li id="cite_note-Music_of_Africa_Columbia_University-238"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Music_of_Africa_Columbia_University_238-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Music_of_Africa_Columbia_University_238-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://www.colum.edu/cbmr/Resources/style-genre-definitions.html" rel="nofollow">"Definitions of Styles and Genres: Traditional and Contemporary African Music"</a>. <i>CBMR</i>. Columbia University<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">3 March</span> 2016</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=CBMR&amp;rft.atitle=Definitions+of+Styles+and+Genres%3A+Traditional+and+Contemporary+African+Music&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.colum.edu%2Fcbmr%2FResources%2Fstyle-genre-definitions.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAfrica"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-239"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-239">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFEstrella">Estrella, Espie. <a class="external text" href="http://musiced.about.com/od/historyofmusic/a/africanmusic.htm" rel="nofollow">"African music"</a>. <i>Music Education</i>. about.com<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">1 March</span> 2014</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Music+Education&amp;rft.atitle=African+music&amp;rft.aulast=Estrella&amp;rft.aufirst=Espie&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fmusiced.about.com%2Fod%2Fhistoryofmusic%2Fa%2Fafricanmusic.htm&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAfrica"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTEMalone19969-240"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEMalone19969_240-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFMalone1996">Malone 1996</a>, p. 9.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTEWelsh-Asante200928-241"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEWelsh-Asante200928_241-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFWelsh-Asante2009">Welsh-Asante 2009</a>, p. 28.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTEWelsh-Asante200935-242"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEWelsh-Asante200935_242-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFWelsh-Asante2009">Welsh-Asante 2009</a>, p. 35.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-243"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-243">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.fiba.basketball/news/getting-to-know-africas-flashy-basketball-arenas" rel="nofollow">"Getting to know Africa's flashy basketball arenas"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/FIBA" title="FIBA">FIBA</a></i>. 2 September 2019. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20210107193242/https://www.fiba.basketball/news/getting-to-know-africas-flashy-basketball-arenas" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 7 January 2021<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">10 December</span> 2020</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=FIBA&amp;rft.atitle=Getting+to+know+Africa%27s+flashy+basketball+arenas&amp;rft.date=2019-09-02&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.fiba.basketball%2Fnews%2Fgetting-to-know-africas-flashy-basketball-arenas&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAfrica"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-244"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-244">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFNxumalo2020">Nxumalo, Lee (20 December 2020). <a class="external text" href="https://www.newframe.com/basketballs-next-frontier-is-africa/" rel="nofollow">"Basketball's next frontier is Africa"</a>. <i>New Frame</i>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20210116062357/https://www.newframe.com/basketballs-next-frontier-is-africa/" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 16 January 2021<span class="reference-accessdate">. </li>
<li id="cite_note-245"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-245">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.rugbyworldcup.com/2023/news/608463/rwc-2023-spotlight-south-africa" rel="nofollow">"RWC 2023 Spotlight: South Africa ｜ Rugby World Cup 2023"</a>. <i>www.rugbyworldcup.com</i>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20210602213126/https://www.rugbyworldcup.com/2023/news/608463/rwc-2023-spotlight-south-africa" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 2 June 2021<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">29 May</span> 2021</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=www.rugbyworldcup.com&amp;rft.atitle=RWC+2023+Spotlight%3A+South+Africa+%EF%BD%9C+Rugby+World+Cup+2023&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rugbyworldcup.com%2F2023%2Fnews%2F608463%2Frwc-2023-spotlight-south-africa&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAfrica"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-246"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-246">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Continental regions as per <a href="/wiki/United_Nations_geoscheme_for_Africa" title="United Nations geoscheme for Africa">UN categorizations/map</a>.<br/></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-uscen-247"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-uscen_247-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/19991128111024/http://www.census.gov/cgi-bin/ipc/idbrank.pl" rel="nofollow">"IDB: Countries Ranked by Population"</a>. 28 November 1999. Archived from the original on 28 November 1999.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=IDB%3A+Countries+Ranked+by+Population&amp;rft.date=1999-11-28&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.census.gov%5C%2Fcgi-bin%2Fipc%2Fidbrank.pl&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAfrica"></span><span class="cs1-maint citation-comment"><code class="cs1-code">{{<a href="/wiki/Template:Cite_web" title="Template:Cite web">cite web</a>}}</code>:  CS1 maint: bot: original URL status unknown (<a href="/wiki/Category:CS1_maint:_bot:_original_URL_status_unknown" title="Category:CS1 maint: bot: original URL status unknown">link</a>)</span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-248"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-248">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The Spanish <a href="/wiki/Canary_Islands" title="Canary Islands">Canary Islands</a>, of which <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Las_Palmas_de_Gran_Canaria" title="Las Palmas de Gran Canaria">Las Palmas de Gran Canaria</a> are <a href="/wiki/Santa_Cruz_de_Tenerife" title="Santa Cruz de Tenerife">Santa Cruz de Tenerife</a> are co-capitals, are often considered part of Northern Africa due to their relative proximity to <a href="/wiki/Morocco" title="Morocco">Morocco</a> and <a href="/wiki/Western_Sahara" title="Western Sahara">Western Sahara</a>; population and area figures are for 2001.<br/></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-249"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-249">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The Spanish <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Exclave" title="Exclave">exclave</a> of <a href="/wiki/Ceuta" title="Ceuta">Ceuta</a> is surrounded on land by Morocco in Northern Africa; population and area figures are for 2001.<br/></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-250"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-250">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Egypt" title="Egypt">Egypt</a> is generally considered a <a href="/wiki/List_of_transcontinental_countries" title="List of transcontinental countries">transcontinental country</a> in Northern Africa (UN region) and Western Asia; population and area figures are for African portion only, west of the <a href="/wiki/Suez_Canal" title="Suez Canal">Suez Canal</a>.<br/></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-251"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-251">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The Portuguese <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Madeira_Islands" title="Madeira Islands">Madeira Islands</a> are often considered part of Northern Africa due to their relative proximity to Morocco; population and area figures are for 2001.<br/></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-252"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-252">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The Spanish <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Exclave" title="Exclave">exclave</a> of <a href="/wiki/Melilla" title="Melilla">Melilla</a> is surrounded on land by Morocco in Northern Africa; population and area figures are for 2001.<br/></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Sahrawi_Arab_Democratic_Republic-253"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Sahrawi_Arab_Democratic_Republic_253-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The territory of <a href="/wiki/Western_Sahara" title="Western Sahara">Western Sahara</a> is claimed by the <a href="/wiki/Sahrawi_Arab_Democratic_Republic" title="Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic">Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic</a> and <a href="/wiki/Morocco" title="Morocco">Morocco</a>. The <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/SADR" title="SADR">SADR</a> is recognized as a sovereign state by the <a href="/wiki/African_Union" title="African Union">African Union</a>. <a href="/wiki/Morocco" title="Morocco">Morocco</a> claims the entirety of the country as its <a href="/wiki/Southern_Provinces" title="Southern Provinces">Southern Provinces</a>. Morocco administers 4/5 of the territory while the SADR controls 1/5. Morocco's annexation of this territory has not been recognized internationally.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-254"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-254">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Bloemfontein" title="Bloemfontein">Bloemfontein</a> is the judicial capital of South Africa, while <a href="/wiki/Cape_Town" title="Cape Town">Cape Town</a> is its legislative seat, and <a href="/wiki/Pretoria" title="Pretoria">Pretoria</a> is the country's administrative seat.<br/></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-255"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-255">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Yamoussoukro" title="Yamoussoukro">Yamoussoukro</a> is the official capital of <a href="/wiki/Ivory_Coast" title="Ivory Coast">Ivory Coast</a>, while <a href="/wiki/Abidjan" title="Abidjan">Abidjan</a> is the <i>de facto</i> seat.</span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>

<li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFGordonDonald_L._Gordon1996">Gordon, April A.; Donald L. Gordon (1996). <i>Understanding Contemporary Africa</i>. Boulder: Lynne Rienner Publishers. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-55587-547-3" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-55587-547-3"><bdi>978-1-55587-547-3</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Understanding+Contemporary+Africa&amp;rft.place=Boulder&amp;rft.pub=Lynne+Rienner+Publishers&amp;rft.date=1996&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-55587-547-3&amp;rft.aulast=Gordon&amp;rft.aufirst=April+A.&amp;rft.au=Donald+L.+Gordon&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAfrica"></span></li>

(1998). <a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/africanexperienc00khap" rel="nofollow"><i>The African experience: an introduction</i></a>. Upper Saddle River, NJ: Prentice Hall. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-13-745852-3" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-13-745852-3"><bdi>978-0-13-745852-3</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+African+experience%3A+an+introduction&amp;rft.place=Upper+Saddle+River%2C+NJ&amp;rft.pub=Prentice+Hall&amp;rft.date=1998&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-13-745852-3&amp;rft.aulast=Khapoya&amp;rft.aufirst=Vincent+B.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Farchive.org%2Fdetails%2Fafricanexperienc00khap&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAfrica"></span></li>
<li>Moore, Clark D., and Ann Dunbar (1968). <i>Africa Yesterday and Today</i>, in series, <i>The George School Readings on Developing Lands</i>. New York: Praeger Publishers.</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/V._S._Naipaul" title="V. S. Naipaul">Naipaul, V.S.</a> <i>The Masque of Africa: Glimpses of African Belief</i>. Picador, 2010. <link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-330-47205-0" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-330-47205-0">978-0-330-47205-0</a></li>

</div></td><td class="noviewer navbox-image" rowspan="3" style="width:1px;padding:0 0 0 2px"><div><a href="/wiki/Africa" title="Africa"><img alt="Africa (orthographic projection).svg" data-file-height="550" data-file-width="550" decoding="async" height="100" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/86/Africa_%28orthographic_projection%29.svg/100px-Africa_%28orthographic_projection%29.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/86/Africa_%28orthographic_projection%29.svg/150px-Africa_%28orthographic_projection%29.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/86/Africa_%28orthographic_projection%29.svg/200px-Africa_%28orthographic_projection%29.svg.png 2x" width="100"/></a></div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%"><div style="display: inline-block; line-height: 1.2em; padding: .1em 0;"><a href="/wiki/List_of_states_with_limited_recognition" title="List of states with limited recognition">States with limited<br/>recognition</a></div></th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-even" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Sahrawi_Arab_Democratic_Republic" title="Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic">Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic</a> (<a href="/wiki/Territorial_dispute" title="Territorial dispute">unclear sovereignty</a>)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Somaliland" title="Somaliland">Somaliland</a></li></ul>

<div class="navbox-styles nomobile"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1061467846" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></div><div aria-labelledby="Articles_related_to_Africa" class="navbox" role="navigation" style="padding:3px"><table class="nowraplinks mw-collapsible mw-collapsed navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit"><tbody><tr><th class="navbox-title" colspan="2" scope="col" style="background:#e8e8ff;"><div id="Articles_related_to_Africa" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em">Articles related to Africa</div></th></tr><tr><td class="navbox-list navbox-odd" colspan="2" style="width:100%;padding:0;font-size:114%"><div style="padding:0px">
<div class="navbox-styles nomobile"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1061467846" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></div><div aria-labelledby="Regional_economic_communities_in_Africa" class="navbox" role="navigation" style="padding:3px"><table class="nowraplinks mw-collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit"><tbody><tr><th class="navbox-title" colspan="2" scope="col"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:African_trade_agreements" title="Template:African trade agreements"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:African_trade_agreements" title="Template talk:African trade agreements"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:African_trade_agreements&amp;action=edit"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div><div id="Regional_economic_communities_in_Africa" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em">Regional economic communities in Africa</div></th></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%">Continental</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd hlist" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">

</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%">Inter-regional</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-even hlist" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">

</p>
